DataElement.preferredName: Cellular Therapy Infusion Procedure Other Institution Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the cellular therapy infusion was performed at a different institution.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cellular Therapy Infusion Procedure Other Institution Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream.

Concepts.definition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.:Executed and carried through to completion.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
